ygData.subject: Re: The boat to Kunark
ygData.msgSnippet: Permafrost is a good zone for the loot, but hard to run out of if overwhelmed. And it is easy to get overwhelmed. I have poked around the front of the zone,
ygData.messageBody:
Permafrost is a good zone for the loot, but hard to run out of if
overwhelmed. And it is easy to get overwhelmed. I have poked around
the front of the zone, becoming familiar with it, but I really think
it is a place for teams more than solo. There are mobs of various
levels all over the place, and if you turn the wrong corner you have
three to five of them chasing you out of the zone. With the right
team one could work systematically into the zone and find the right
mobs for particular drops.

Most of those I see hunting there are in the 40's and 50's, killing
greens for particular loot. I have followed some of them and
scavanged some things I have needed, but again I will only go so deep
by myself. For whacking greens for loot it is a great zone. You can
start at the front and work your way as deep as is safe, then go back
and start again.

I am finding Gnolls to be good at this time. I can solo them in SK,
with lots of room for kiting. If things go well I can root and dot
them across only a small part of the zone, having as much as half of
my mana left. If things go bad, I can still make the kill before the
mana is completely drained.

While there I forage for plains pebbles. I have almost a full tool
box of them in my bank. They are very useful for the Vale tailoring.

Barto Proudfoot
lvl 32 Halfling Druid

--- In EverQuest@y..., Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...> wrote:
> What about permafrost.?
> I was out there yesterday and there were only 6 people
> in there. Tough to find a group but it seems to have
> high level monsters in it
>
> rob
>
> --- bigmaca3 <bigmaca3@y...> wrote:
> > --- In EverQuest@y..., "mlockridge01"
> > <MLockridge01@c...> wrote:
> > > The other day I decided that a trip to Kunark was
> > in order for my
> > > druid. I will be needing Brute hides, and so was
> > ready to go and
> > hunt
> > > them. However, the shuttles in Butcherblock never
> > met the boat. I
> > > tried three times, three different shuttles, and
> > they went out to
> > > Timerous Deep, got close to the boat, then the
> > boat left. The
> > > shuttles just went back to BB.
> > >
> > > That avenue being out, I returned to SK to pick
> > off gnolls, and
> > > forage Plains Pebbles. I almost have my bank tool
> > box full of them.
> > > have about eight to go. So, decided to stay there
> > until I get the
> > > rest.
> > >
> > > Plus I have been getting fs weapons from the
> > gnolls, which I have
> > > tried to make into another Vale Sewing Kit to
> > sell.
> > >
> > > Hope they get the boat fixed. For my first trip I
> > want to do it the
> > > old-fashioned way.
> > >
> > > Barto Proudfoot
> >
> > I've found the big boat to FV to be broken too.
> > Luckily I have a
> > friend that's a Druid so I got a port to the DL. I
> > tried to petition
> > the GM but it doesn't work if there isn't one on!
> >
> > Kunark is a dangerous place for the good races. The
> > only place you
> > can bind a good melee is in FV and it's surrounded
> > by mid-level
> > mobs. If you port over you end up in the DL, which
> > is ok, it's just
> > getting out of there that's the problem! The DL
> > does have
> > connections to the FM and FV if you know where to
> > look. It's not a
> > place to be without a map!
> >
> > And I am also looking for a place to take me to the
> > mid-40's. I've
> > been to the moon, Kunark, the Karanas and Velious.
> > I like to go to
> > the zones that have been abandoned, like all the
> > dungones on
> > Anatonica. I'm in the FM now and will probably be
> > in the DL, like
> > everyone else.
> >
> > Tuldayen Grimblade
> > 37th Season Ranger of Tunare
> > Teris-Thule
> >
> >
>
